column4: hello: i would like a friend to view a website on my local pc..but i have aserver in germany, so normally i do: ssh -L 3128:localhost:3128 user@host
and then i set my browser proxy to localhost : 3128 and its working..
but how to do so that i tunnel from germany to my local pc?
and im firewalled - so i want to make a ssh tunnel...then he can go to germanyserver:5050 and he will see my site
i only want him to reach port 80 via the tunnel
so on germany:5050 will forward to localhost:80
but it doesnt run on ubuntu
is this what you want to do?  => http://www.securityfocus.com/infocus/1816
man, that howto rocks! im checking it out but i get this error: /home/win/.ssh/config line 3: Missing target argument.
my config is the same so im not sure..
post your ssh config in pastebin
looks like it's complaining about .ssh/config, so that one
